clinical_study.official_title: Prognostic Value of Trichoscopy in Patients With Systemic Scleroderma

brief_summary.textblock:
- Few data are available on scalp involvement in systemic scleroderma.
- Few data are available on the association between scalp abnormalities and features of systemic scleroderma
- Trichoscopy is a simple, reproducible, noninvasive examination that is part of the examination of hairy areas in routine dermatologic practice
- There is a lack of simple, noninvasive examinations to evaluate patients with systemic scleroderma
The objective will be to evaluate the contribution of trichoscopy in the evaluation of patients with systemic scleroderma

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of elementary lesions observed by trichoscopic assessment of the scalp
primary_outcome.description: Comparison of the frequencies of elementary lesions visualized in patients with systemic scleroderma and healthy subjects

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between visceral damage of systemic scleroderma and trichoscopic features
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of visceral damage of systemic scleroderma: pulmonary hypertension, lung fibrosis, kidney failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between global severity of systemic scleroderma and trichoscopic features
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between EUSTAR score, Rodnan score, Medsger's score and trichoscopic features

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between autoimmune profile of sclerodermic patients and trichoscopic features
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of antibodies, inflammatory profile of patients with trichoscopic features.

arm_group.description: healthy subject without systemic scleroderma or known hair or scalp disease

intervention.description: We will perform a non-invasive assessment of the scalp with a dermoscope by taking two standardized pictures on the frontal area and the occipital area in order to a blinded analysis of trichoscopic patterns
intervention.other_name: Non-invasive trichoscopy: dermoscopic assessment of the scalp (picture)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient who fulfils the Systemic scleroderma ACR-EULAR 2013 criteria
- Signed informed consent
- Being social insured
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged less than 18 years old
- patients under legal protection
- patients deprived of their liberty
- patients in emergency situations
- patients who refused or unable to give informed consent
- For the control group: sclap inflammatory disease active the day of the examination
